study_plan_entry.title: Physical models for micro and nanosystems

en.title: Physical models for micro and nanosystems

free_text.Forme d'enseignement: Ex cathedra and exercises on a computer
free_text.Contenu: 1. Finite element method - background and implementation[br/]2. Modeling electrostatic problems, voltage and charge distribution[br/]3. Micro and nanoelectromechanical devices: mechanical properties, modeling electromechanical coupling[br/]4. Detection systems for x-ray and gamma ray imaging devices[br/]5. Modeling of fluid mechanics in micro and nanosystems[br/]6. Modeling heat transfer[br/]
free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: Students will learn the theoretical background of finite element modeling as well as its application to modeling charge, mass and heat transport in electronic, fluidic and electromechanical micro and nanosystems.

fr.title: Physical models for micro and nanosystems
